intro: Costus cylindricus var. ciliatus, commonly known as the velvet costus, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its smooth, dark green leaves with a slightly hairy texture along the margins. The plant produces striking, orange-red spadices that are typical of the Zingiberaceae family. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and aromatic properties.
